Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47.Controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47.Controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualViewListener
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements VirtualViewListener
This class represents the controller of the game. It creates the instance of the game with all its elements and contains all the methods used to update the model.

  • Field Summary

    Fields

    private TurnController turn  
    private java.util.ArrayList<VirtualView> views  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GameController​(int numberOfPlayers, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Color> mapUserColor, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​VirtualView> mapUserVirtualView)
    This is the constructor of the GameController which creates the game and set the random player who will choose the gods that can be used in this game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController​(int numberOfPlayers, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Color> mapUserColor, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​VirtualView> mapUserVirtualView)
      This is the constructor of the GameController which creates the game and set the random player who will choose the gods that can be used in this game.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - the number of player of the game which is chosen by the first player who connect.
      mapUserColor - usernames and colors of each player.
      mapUserVirtualView - usernames and Virtual Views of each player

  • Method Details

    • setNumberOfPlayers

      public void setNumberOfPlayers​(int numberOfPlayers)

    • chooseChallenger

      private Player chooseChallenger()
      This method choose a random player who will decide which gods can be used in the game and the order of the players in a round.
      Returns:
      the instance of the chosen player

    • startController

      private void startController()
      This method is the first method which is launched in the constructor to make the game start.

    • setGods

      public void setGods​(java.util.ArrayList<GodName> gods, java.lang.String chosenPlayer)
      Update the model with the gods that will be used in the game.
      Parameters:
      gods - list of chosen gods.
      chosenPlayer - the username of the first player

    • setGod

      public void setGod​(GodName god)
      This method sets the god that has been chosen by a player in his class. It also delete this god from the list of available gods.
      Parameters:
      god - the chosen god

    • setWorkers

      public void setWorkers​(int[] RowsAndColumns)
      This method set both workers into their correspondent slots, checking if they're already occupied, if they are two different slots or if they are out of range. If all these checks are negative the slots are setted, otherwise the method sends an error and asks again.
      Parameters:
      RowsAndColumns - the initial positions of the workers that will be set

    • newRoundOrder

      private void newRoundOrder()
      This method creates the order that will be follow during the game. The first player has been chosen by the Challenger, then the order remains the same. It must be called at the start of the game.

    • startGame

      private void startGame()
      This method creates the order of the round for the whole game and then it sends all the public information to all the players.

    • setView

      private void setView​(VirtualView view)
      Add a view to the ArrayList views.
      Parameters:
      view - the view that has to be added.

    • removeView

      private void removeView​(VirtualView view)

    • orderViews

      private void orderViews()
      This method order the ArrayList of Virtual Views the same as the players in the Game class. This is because the indexOfCurrentPlayer must refers to the player and to the VirtualView at the same time.

    • changeTurn

      public void changeTurn()
      This method create a new turn of the game and makes it start.

    • incrementIndex

      private void incrementIndex()
      This method increments the index of the current player. If it is equal to the number of player, a new round is starting.

    • fixIndexAndStart

      private void fixIndexAndStart()
      This method is used just in the case when the third player lose the game. It fixes the index of the other players and start a new turn.

    • sendWhoseIsTheTurn

      void sendWhoseIsTheTurn()
      This method sends an advice to all the players, except for the one who is playing, to inform them about who is playing in the current turn.

    • removeLosingPlayer

      void removeLosingPlayer​(java.lang.String username)
      This method deletes a losing player from the game and notifies all the players. If the players were just two, it also declares the winner and ends the game.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of a loser

    • endGame

      void endGame​(java.lang.String username)
      This method close the game when someone has won.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the winner

    • sendAnAdviceDuringGame

      void sendAnAdviceDuringGame​(java.lang.String changes)
      This method sends to all the players the information about the evolution of the game, for example which player has just build, or which player has chosen the worker to use.
      Parameters:
      changes - the action which has to be communicated.

    • update

      public void update​(Visitable visitableObject)
      This method implements the update of the Observer Pattern. It's called every time the virtual view receives a message from the client side, so its content is notified to the controller.
      Specified by:
      update in interface VirtualViewListener
      Parameters:
      visitableObject - the content of the message.

    • clearController

      void clearController()
      This method sets all the elements to null. It's used in the tests to clear the game.

    • getViews

      java.util.ArrayList<VirtualView> getViews()

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      public int getNumberOfPlayers()

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()

    • getIndexOfCurrentPlayer

      int getIndexOfCurrentPlayer()

    • setIndexOfCurrentPlayer

      public void setIndexOfCurrentPlayer​(int indexOfCurrentPlayer)

    • getAvailableGods

      public java.util.ArrayList<GodName> getAvailableGods()

    • getTurn

      public TurnController getTurn()
